originInfo.publisher: Louisiana. Dept. of Wildlife and Fisheries

mods.abstract: An electric fence. Such fences are used to protect good muskrat marshes from cattle. Note the difference in height of grass on grazed (right) as opposed to ungrazed (left).

titleInfo.title: Louisiana Sea Grant Digital Images Collection

mods.accessCondition: Physical rights are retained by Donald W. Davis. Copyright of federal and state documents is in the public domain.
Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.
mods.note: ONeil, T. The muskrat in the Louisiana coastal marshes: a study of the ecological, geological, biological, tidal, and climatic factors governing the production and management of the muskrat industry in Louisiana. New Orleans: Louisiana Department of Wildlife and Fisheries, 1949.
